buildFast.title: 45% lower cost, 5x faster
buildFast.description: Total cost of 2,600 PLN/m² vs 4,300-4,800 PLN/m² for alternatives. Shell construction in 1-4 weeks vs 6-12 months. Only 4-6 labor hours per m²—two people with basic tools can build an entire home.

sustainable.title: 4x lower carbon footprint
sustainable.description: ≤150 kg CO₂eq/m² vs 600-750 kg for traditional methods. 97% recyclable materials. No concrete or steel required. Fully compliant with EU 2026-2030 decarbonisation targets and taxonomy requirements.

precision.title: Passive-house standard
precision.description: U-value of 0.09 W/m²K—40-47% better thermal performance than any competitor. Airtightness of n₅₀ < 0.2 h⁻¹. CNC-manufactured components ensure zero thermal bridges and 100+ year lifespan.

hero.title: Reinventing construction
hero.description: We built a patented technology that makes homes 45% cheaper, 5x faster to build, and 4x more sustainable. Here's why we believe the timing is perfect.

story.title: The Problem We're Solving
story.paragraph1: Europe faces a housing crisis: 1 million+ homes needed annually, yet traditional construction is too slow (6-12 months), too expensive (rising 8% yearly), and too carbon-intensive (40% of global emissions). Meanwhile, construction labor is shrinking—25% of workers will retire by 2030.
story.paragraph2: Our patented comb-beam system fundamentally changes the economics. By using interlocking wood-based panels instead of structural timber, we've eliminated the supply chain bottlenecks and skilled labor requirements that plague the industry. Two people with basic tools can now build what previously required a 10-person crew.
story.paragraph3: The numbers prove it: 45% lower total cost, 1-4 week shell construction, U-value of 0.09 W/m²K (exceeding passive house), and carbon footprint 4-5x lower than alternatives. These aren't incremental improvements—they're category-defining advantages protected by patent.
story.imageAlt: Completed Combstruct building structure showcasing our modular construction system

mission.title: Why Now
mission.description: EU 2026-2030 decarbonisation mandates are forcing the industry to change. ESG requirements are making traditional construction economically unviable. We're positioned at the exact moment when the market must adopt solutions like ours.

vision.title: Our Technology Moat
vision.description: Our patented comb-beam interlocking system is unique: it uses standard wood-based panels to create infinite-length beams, universal wall/ceiling/roof cores, and requires no structural timber—making us immune to lumber market volatility.

values.title: Compliance Ready
values.description: Full compliance with EU taxonomy requirements and 2026-2030 decarbonisation programmes. Our ≤150 kg CO₂eq/m² footprint is 4-5x better than required thresholds.

cta.title: Interested in our technology?

hero.title: Frequently Asked
hero.description: Everything you need to know about our patented comb-beam technology and how it compares to traditional construction methods.

1.q: What is the Combstruct comb-beam system?
1.a: Combstruct uses patented comb-beam technology—interlocking wood-based panels (MFP or OSB-3) that form a universal load-bearing core for walls, ceilings, and roofs. Unlike traditional timber framing, our system requires no structural timber, concrete, or steel. The interlocking design creates beams of theoretically unlimited length and eliminates the need for lintels, cornices, or reinforcements.

2.q: How long does construction actually take?
2.a: Shell construction with full thermal insulation and airtightness takes 1-4 weeks—that's 3-10x faster than alternatives. Traditional brick construction takes 28-44 weeks, timber frame takes 12-20 weeks, and prefab takes 6-12 weeks. Our system requires only 4-6 labor hours per m², compared to 12-25 hours for other methods.

3.q: What types of buildings can be constructed?
3.a: The system adapts to any building type: single-family homes, multi-unit apartments, commercial spaces, offices, tenement superstructures (rooftop additions), and outbuildings. The uniform structural cross-section works identically for walls, ceilings, and roofs—no geometry changes between building elements.

1.q: What materials does the system use?
1.a: The core uses standardized wood-based panels (MFP or OSB-3)—no structural timber required. This makes us immune to lumber market price volatility. Insulation options include mineral wool, EPS, XPS, PUR, hempcrete, or pressed straw. Unlike timber frame construction, our wood-based panels support both open-diffusion and closed-diffusion insulators.

2.q: What thermal performance does the system achieve?
2.a: Our buildings achieve a U-value of 0.09 W/m²K—40-47% better than timber frame (0.16), prefab (0.17), or traditional brick (0.15). Airtightness reaches n₅₀ < 0.2 h⁻¹ at 50 Pa with spray membrane coating. This exceeds passive house standards as a default, not an upgrade.

3.q: What facade and finishing options are available?
3.a: The coffered core imposes no restrictions. Facades: ETICS systems, ventilated facades (fiber cement, HPL, sheet metal, tiles, green walls). Roofing: felt, PVC, TPO, EPDM, standing seam, metal tiles, shingles, green roofs, concrete/ceramic tiles. Interiors: standard drywall systems with a 45mm installation layer for plumbing, electrical, and smart home systems.

4.a: 100+ years with proper maintenance. The system has zero thermal bridges, no hygroscopic deformation, and stable properties over time. The uniform cross-section from foundation to roof eliminates weak points found in hybrid construction systems.

1.q: Can two people really build a house?
1.a: Yes. The system requires only 4-6 labor hours per m² and can be assembled by two people with basic power tools—no specialist qualifications needed. Traditional construction requires 18-25 hours/m² and specialized trades. Our detailed assembly guides and CNC-precision components ensure perfect fit every time.

2.q: What about building permits and regulations?
2.a: Our designs meet all EU building codes and energy regulations. We provide complete documentation for permit applications. The system is fully compliant with EU 2026-2030 decarbonisation requirements and taxonomy standards—increasingly important as regulations tighten.

3.a: All materials for a complete house fit in two standard TIR semi-trailers. We deliver throughout Europe with components precision-cut and ready for assembly. No on-site cutting or fitting required—this eliminates waste and weather dependencies.

1.q: How does the cost compare to other methods?
1.a: Total cost: 2,600 PLN/m² including structure, insulation, and membranes. Competitors: timber frame 4,300 PLN/m², prefab 4,400 PLN/m², traditional brick 4,800 PLN/m². That's 45% savings—achieved by eliminating structural timber, concrete, steel, and reducing labor by 3-5x.

2.q: What's included in the base price?
2.a: All structural components (comb-beam panels), thermal insulation, membrane systems, and exterior sheathing. Windows, doors, facade finishing, interior finishing, utilities, and foundation are priced separately or included in full-service packages. Contact us for a detailed breakdown.

3.a: Carbon footprint: ≤150 kg CO₂eq/m²—that's 4-5x lower than traditional construction (600-750 kg). Recyclability: 97% of components can be recycled or reused at end of life. No concrete or steel means the building can be fully dismantled and materials recovered, unlike conventional construction.
